title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manhole covers exploded on Newbury Street in Boston, causing evacuations and street closures on February 3, 2026.
Sidewalks from Gloucester to Dartmouth Street and four buildings were evacuated, with no injuries reported, fire officials said.
Streets closed due to the explosions included Newbury, Exeter, and Dartmouth Streets between Boylston and Commonwealth Avenue.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station fare gates remain out of service over a week after a major Boston snowstorm.
The gates were shut down preemptively and wrapped to protect them from the storm's elements.
The MBTA and contractors are evaluating damage to the $3.3 million gates for repair readiness.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the 2025 Patriots' mentality and compares them to his championship teams.
Mike Vrabel emphasizes building a new program, contrasting with past Patriots dynasty under Brady.
McCourty reflects on the Patriots' current approach and contrasts it with the team's historic expectations.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, from Canton, pleaded guilty to five charges, including forgery and identity fraud, accepting a plea deal.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years probation, over $9,000 restitution, and banned from Boston Public Schools and social work.
During 2022-2023, Hewitt used aliases to enroll at three Boston high schools, attending classes and joining the basketball team.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools initiates a partial hiring freeze amid a projected $53 million budget deficit for the fiscal year.
The School Committee voted to close Lee Academy, ACC, and CASH schools by 2027, affecting up to 400 educator jobs.
BPS faces cost overruns in health insurance, transportation, and special education, lacking federal COVID relief support.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell entertains Patriots with 'Weekend Update'-style segments during Friday meetings under Coach Mike Vrabel's guidance.
Campbell's antics, including a TD Garden beer chug, have made him popular among teammates and fans alike.
Despite injuries, Campbell bolstered Patriots' offensive line, recognized as significant addition by Pro Football Focus.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Mela Rosario, 17, from Dorchester reported missing after last seen near Brockton courthouse on Thursday.
Rosario described as 5'1", brown skin, medium build, with brown eyes and hair, last seen in pink jacket.
Police urge anyone with information to contact Boston Police or District C-11 Detectives at (617) 343-4335.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Kraft advanced to the finalist stage in 2026 after being on the ballot since 2013; Belichick was a first-year candidate.
Devin McCourty criticized the omissions, suggesting they could overshadow the Hall of Fame induction ceremony.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics traded Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to the Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
Nikola Vučević, averaging 16.9 points and 9 rebounds, will strengthen Boston's frontcourt and lower their luxury tax penalty.
Anfernee Simons averaged 14.2 points this season off the bench after being acquired in the offseason Jrue Holiday trade.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Robert Kraft, Patriots owner, was not voted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame 2026 Class.
Mike Vrabel expressed support for Kraft, calling him deserving of Hall of Fame induction.
Since Kraft's ownership, the Patriots have won six Super Bowls and 20 division titles.
